lead_paragraph: Troy Polamalu, the Pittsburgh Steelers’ star safety, signed a four-year contract extension yesterday worth $30.19 million, making him the highest-paid player in team history and one of the N.F.L.’s top-paid defensive backs. The deal guarantees that the Steelers can keep him through the 2011 season, when he will be 30.Polamalu, an All-Pro safety in 2005, was set to make $1,088,000 and $1,722,000 in bonuses this season. His extension kicks in next season and will pay him $15,375,000 during the 2008-11 seasons in guaranteed money and roster bonuses, which are automatically paid as long as he is on the team.
